intro: Dyckia andina, commonly known as the Andean dyckia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of trichomes. The plant produces striking inflorescences with bright red or orange flowers that bloom in the summer. Dyckia andina is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained soils with ample sunlight. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
